Comments.Message:
Hi There,

The InputSimulator uses the standard Win32 SendInput method which comes with
certain basic restrictions, and more so under Windows Vista/7.  Are you
using Vista or Windows 7?  If so this may have something to do with
elevation.  I found a post here which may help isolate the
problem.

http://www.eggheadcafe.com/software/aspnet/29620442/how-to-proper-use-sendinput-to-a-elevated-window-from-a-service.aspx

If you still have the issue please let me know so we can look into it
further since there may be a bug in the way I'm setting up the structures to
push into the SendInput method.  I know there's an outstanding issue with
non-standard unicode characters which I'm trying to get to...

Kind Regards,
Mike

Like many others, I was facing this problem too, when sending keystrokes to a remote session.

The problems seems to be, tha remote sessions - being RDP or ICA sessions - requires KEYBDINPUT.Scan to be non-zero.

The way I solved the problem (quick and dirty), was to duplicate e.g. SimulateKeyDown into SimulateKeyDownEx and set Scan by using the MapVirtualKey API in that method.

I have attached the source files changed, for this to work.

Best regards
Ernst Mikkelsen
